***Reopening Update***

The KCIA Board of Education approved to delay the start of the school year until September 8.

Additionally, all students in grades 4 through 8 will start the year in a virtual format for at least the first quarter.

K-3rd grade students who elected to attend school in the building will start in the building on September 8th. K-3rd students who elected to attend school virtually will also start the virtual program at home on September 8th.

There will be no early release Wednesdays during the new school year.

All students who will be learning virtually at home will have meals delivered to their homes.

If you have any questions, feel free to reach our office at 816 - 242 4206.

Girls on the Run Serving Greater Kansas City
March 18 at 2:27 PM ·

For today's #WomanCrushWednesday we'd like to spotlight our 2020 Fry Orthodontic Specialists Positive Contribution Award Winner, Mashahir Ahmed. Mashahir is a student at Kansas City International Academy and a three-time Girls on the Run participant. After moving to the United States from Sudan in 2017, Mashahir joined Girls on the Run determined to participate and make friends in a brand new environment. She quickly became a leader on the team, despite a language barrier, through her work ethic and determination. Mashahir received a new pair of running shoes from Girls on the Run so she did not have to run in sandals, and was one of the first girls to advocate for a Girls on the Run sport hijab. We're looking forward to celebrating Mashahir at our Every Girl Evening on June 3!

KCIA is excited to begin Let Me Run this year! Let Me Run is a program that combines exercise with fun activities and lessons to help boys learn teamwork, build relationship skills, create friendships, grow emotionally, amplify their self-esteem, empower themselves and others, and live an active lifestyle. Let Me Run nurtures and celebrates every aspect of what it really means to be a boy, and we let them run.

Please help KCIA in bringing this program to our students. To defer costs for our families we are working to raise money to cover the cost of the program for 14 boys and buy each boy a pair of running shoes. Any donation helps.

Thanks so much for your consideration and help towards the boys of KCIA taking part in this great program.

Global FC Education Program
June 17, 2019 at 8:24 AM ·

It's been a busy first two weeks of summer for our Education Program! So far, we've...
...figured out summer school for many of our students thanks to help from KCPS Language Services
...had our first two tutoring sessions at Kansas City International Academy
...had our first two Soccer Literacy sessions at KCIA
...had our first Story Club session led by Tim Hange from Calvary University at Northeast High School
...had our first two Soccer Literacy sessions of the summer at James Elementary
...went on a campus visit to MCC-Blue River Campus
and had our first tutoring session with James Elementary, Wendell Phillips Elementary at Attucks, and Scuola Vita Nuova Charter School students at the Olive Center, a space available to us thanks to United Way of Greater Kansas City.
Summer is a busy time, and we're happy to keep learning and growing together! We look forward to what the upcoming weeks will bring!
